The best writing advice for 2020, featuring prominent bloggers such as James Clear and David Perell.
From Dan Dimmock on Unsplash
One Sentence Summary
ðŸ’¡
Follow David Perell & James Clear, read Scott Adams and Paul Graham blog posts. For a full overview, read this blog post
Content Creators to Watch
David Perell
Great thread on writing by David Perell. His twitter account is full of wisdom.
David Perell on The Power of Writing - Modern Wisdom - Podcast Notes
Watch the episode here Key Takeaways It's a better time than ever to write online There is SO MUCH demand from people who want high-level, interesting ideas The 3-Step Process For Changing Your Career Pick a small, emerging industry Learn as much as you can about it Share what you
https://podcastnotes.org/2019/05/15/perell/
For writing articles:
David Perell: Article Outline Process
This is my process for outlining articles. It's built on principles from Tiago Forte's Building a Second Brain course and my Write of Passage course. https://buildingasecondbrain.com https://writeofpassage.school
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Mj0u-IFpLw
1 hour overview of his process:
How We Write: David Perell and Nik Sharma
I've written a handful of articles about the direct-to-consumer boom with Nik. In this video, we outlined our process for talking through ideas and turning them into an outline. If you're interested in the cutting-edge of collaborative writing, this video is for you.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wg-PiNEngxQ
James Clear
Author of Atomic Habits. A clear, concise non-fiction writer.
Great insights in this thread
How to Write Like James Clear, Bestselling Author of Atomic Habits
Every couple weeks I dive into a different writer's creative process. This week's deep-dive is practical-science writer James Clear-one of my favorite thinkers today. If you haven't heard of James by now, you soon will. He's a longtime blogger about habits, health, and psychology. And now he's the ultra-bestselling author of the book Atomic Habits .
https://blog.shanesnow.com/how-to-write-like-james-clear-bestselling-author-of-atomic-habits-dbb25bbaffa0
Best Writing Books | James Clear
Looking for good writing books? This is my list of the best writing books of all-time. If you only have time to read one or two books, I recommend looking at the Top Writing Books section below. Further down the page, you'll find more writing book recommendations.
https://jamesclear.com/best-books/writing
6 Tips for Better Writing From Best-Selling Author James Clear
Tip #1: Write about what fascinates you James Clear is a massively successful blogger, world-renown habits expert, and best-selling author. Needless to say, the guy knows his stuff. So when I saw a section in one of his recent email newsletters entitled "A few tips on how to be a better writer," I was...
https://medium.com/better-marketing/6-tips-for-better-writing-from-best-selling-author-james-clear-cdeb6f10f53a
Blog Posts
All the best rules in one place, contains wisdom from every resource mentioned
How to Write Better: The Definitive Guide
The best way to sell an idea is with illustrative story. Notes are meant to be used, not stockpiled. I delete almost as many notes every day as I create. - Tiago Forte, paraphrased To get new ideas, make time for non-doing. Don't fill every minute.
https://www.rudbits.com/blog/how-to-write-better?ck_subscriber_id=651571714
Short writing rules by Paul Graham, founder of Y-Combinator
Writing, Briefly
March 2005 (In the process of answering an email, I accidentally wrote a tiny essay about writing. I usually spend weeks on an essay. This one took 67 minutes-23 of writing, and 44 of rewriting.) I think it's far more important to write well than most people realize.
http://www.paulgraham.com/writing44.html
80% of the rules of writing by Scott Adams. Naval Ravikant recommends this blog post
The Day You Became A Better Writer
I went from being a bad writer to a good writer after taking a one-day course in "business writing." I couldn't believe how simple it was. I'll tell you the main tricks here so you don't have to waste a...
https://dilbertblog.typepad.com/the_dilbert_blog/2007/06/the_day_you_bec.html
Essay Writing Guide by Jordan Peterson
https://docs.google.com/viewer?url=http://jordanbpeterson.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Essay_Writing_Guide.docx
Comprehensive Elements of Writing to go deeper
It's Elementary
An Elemental Approach to Mastery The Elements of Writing, developed by Charlie Euchner, offers a unique system for mastering writing in all fields. Based on the latest research on learning and the brain, The Elements of Writing takes the tedium out of writing by tapping into your passions and interests.
https://theelementsofwriting.com/elements/
How to write a best selling book
How to Write a Bestselling Book This Year - The Definitive Resource List and How-To Guide
If you want to write a bestselling book, don't reinvent the wheel. I get at least a dozen email a week from friends who want to write books. After three #1 bestsellers from 2007 to 2012, and publishing in 35+ countries, I've tried a lot. Having experimented with everything from "traditional" (Random House) to Amazon...
https://tim.blog/2014/02/04/how-to-get-published/
Books
Draft no 4. John McPhee
Great writing on structure for non fiction writers
Great Summary
John McPhee's Step-By-Step Approach to Narrative Nonfiction
No one in our time has contributed more to nonfiction narrative--stories that are true--than John McPhee. And he has lessons to teach. McPhee is the writer for The New Yorker and creative writing professor at Princeton University.
https://theelementsofwriting.com/mcphee/
Writing with the Master - The Magic of John McPhee
If I could study non-fiction writing with anyone, it would be John McPhee. He is a staff writer at The New Yorker, a four-time finalist for the Pulitzer Prize, and he won that award in 1999 for Annals of the Former World. Even more impressive to me, he can turn any subject -- truly, any...
https://tim.blog/2014/12/11/john-mcphee/
Podcast:
Robert Wright & John McPhee [The Wright Show]
00:42 Why John's books have never included an author photo 08:37 On the inadequacy of the term 'nonfiction' 21:53 The importance of a really good lede 33:42 John's simple cure for writer's block 51:22 Why John likes to challenge the reader's vocabulary Robert Wright (Bloggingheads.tv, The Evolution of God, Nonzero, Why Buddhism Is True) and John McPhee (Princeton University, Draft No.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qytux831HIQ
The Elements of Style
Comprehensive basic rules, but worth reading with scepticism
Strunk, William, Jr. 1918. The Elements of Style
Make definite assertions. Avoid tame, colorless, hesitating, non-committal language.- Rule 12 WilliamStrunk, Jr. The Elements of Style William Strunk, Jr. Asserting that one must first know the rules to break them, this classic reference book is a must-have for any student and conscientious writer.
https://www.bartleby.com/141/index.html
Ten Principles of Style: On Strunk & White
On Strunk & White's famous writing guide, The Elements of Style. In this video, we examine ten principles of good writing, including "Make the paragraph the unit of composition," and "Place the emphatic words of a sentence at the end." A perfect guide to improving your writing, to achieving greater concision and clarity in your work!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MfQB3y8ayRU
The Sense of Style
The Sense of Style: The Thinking Person's Guide to Writing in the 21st Century
"Charming and erudite . . . The wit and insight and clarity he brings . . . is what makes this book such a gem." -Time.com Why is so much writing so bad, and how can we make it better? Is the English language being corrupted by texting and social media?
https://stevenpinker.com/publications/sense-style-thinking-persons-guide-writing-21st-century
Linguistics, Style and Writing in the 21st Century - with Steven Pinker
Does writing well matter in an age of instant communication? Drawing on the latest research in linguistics and cognitive science, Steven Pinker replaces the recycled dogma of style guides with reason and evidence.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OV5J6BfToSw
5 Minute overview
Steven Pinker on bad and good writing
The psychologist and word-usage expert has produced a new style guide with cognitive sensibilities called "The Sense of Style". For more multimedia content from The Economist visit our website: http://econ.st/1uESjz9
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IMVOHeQYCUY
Video
1 hour 20 minute overview
LEADERSHIP LAB: The Craft of Writing Effectively
Do you worry about the effectiveness of your writing style? As emerging scholars, perfecting the craft of writing is an essential component of developing as graduate students, and yet resources for honing these skills are largely under utilized.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vtIzMaLkCaM
Essential Twitter Thread
Tips from Shane Parrish of Farnam Street
Apps
Make your writing crisp:
Hemingway Editor
http://www.hemingwayapp.com/
Writing assistant with a student discount
Great Writing,Simplified
Grammarly allows me to get those communications out and feel confident that I'm putting my best foot forward. Grammarly is like a little superpower, especially when I need to be at 110%." Jeanette Stock Co-founder of Venture Out
https://www.grammarly.com/
Analyze your email writing
Boomerang for Gmail: Scheduled sending and email reminders
Inbox Pause stops new email from coming into your Inbox until you're ready for it. Studies show that checking email only a few times a day reduces stress and boosts productivity.
https://www.boomeranggmail.com/
Useful Graphics
Amazon tips:
Why sentence length matters:
Steven Pinker's Writing Rules:
Advice I've taken
Read books often. My writing has improved immensely since developing a reading habit (~1 hour a day).
Act like every word costs you money â†’ I review my sentences for words like really and just.
Simplicity > Jargon
I take up any writing opportunity I can â†’ I joined toastmasters to write more speeches, and started writing for a student blog.
Read more tweets as Twitters character limit makes for concise writing.
The first sentence must grab the reader â†’ I look for this in everything I read
Other Skills to learn
Learn how to tell great stories (pair with listening to more stories through story corps)
Writing high value content from James Clear
Cover from Alvaro Serrano on Unsplash
posts.title: The Best Resources on Writing: All the Essential Rules You Need to Know
posts.desc: The best writing advice for 2020, featuring prominent bloggers such as James Clear and David Perell.
